media_attachments.description: Thermal Image of a street in Cardiff, of an area that does not have the health benefits derived from enough trees.

card.title: CoedCadw (@CoedCadw@toot.wales)
card.description:
Attached: 2 images

🧵Here's two images of a street in #cardiff Wales. 

During the heatwave of 2023 we commissioned Thermal imaging Ltd to record the temperature within the trees shade, & from the surrounding area.

The results directly illustrated the cooling effect of that single urban tree.

1📸Thermal Image
2📸Photo

Trees, save lives & money! 

https://woodlandtrust.org.uk/protecting-trees-and-woods/benefits-of-urban-trees/tree-equity/

#TreeEquity 


#trees #coedcadw #climatechange #climatecrisis #climate #wales #uk - #woodlandtrust #climatediary
card.image_description:
Thermal image of a street in Adamsdown, Cardiff, in a position where there's a single street tree. 

The image is annotated with spot temperatures. The exposed tarmac records 41.9 Degrees C at the highest, and the lowest in the tree shade on the road records 22.2 Degrees C

descendants.content: @nspugh @davidoclubb @CoedCadw 50⁰C? Humans might but I doubt that tree or those plants would. Its not just the temperature that would go up rainfall would continue to change, wind strength everything. 50⁰C in Wales is something we should be looking to stop not adapt to and stuff every other creature in our country

descendants.content:
@Beedazzled @nspugh @davidoclubb @CoedCadw

Exactly. Talking about 'solutions' is the sort of drivel that will be used by the Mail and Telegraph to legitimise continued fossil fuel use.

The reality will not only be fractured ecosystems but massive social conflict. Starvation will bring disorder.

account.note: My main themes here are gardening, nature and conservation, green energy and open source software but my frustration with the way billionaires are trashing our world will inevitably feature at times.

descendants.content: @lionelb @Beedazzled @nspugh @CoedCadw 50 degrees is coming whether we like it or not. To thrive and survive we need to change everything about how our urban environments operate
